intro: Parrya nudicaulis var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the pinnatifid parrya, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The species is often found in open habitats such as slopes and gravelly plains, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
